1.meeting: Leonardo spent his final years at Francis I’s Château du Clos Lucé in Amboise (1516–1519), under the king’s direct patronage, and—according to Vasari—died in Francis’s arms on May 2, 1519.

2.meeting: Cellini was summoned to Francis’s court at Fontainebleau around 1540 to work as a goldsmith and sculptor—documented in royal accounts—and lived there as the king’s principal artist.

3.meeting: Vasari interviewed and knew Cellini in Florence during the 1550s for his _Lives of the Artists_, spending time at Cellini’s workshop in the Accademia del Disegno.

4.meeting: Vasari presented plans for the new chapel at Santa Croce in Bosco Marengo to Pope Pius IV around 1560, when the pope commissioned him as chief architect of the Vatican palaces.

5.meeting: Miyazaki was invited to speak at a Vatican cultural forum in 1992, where he met John Paul II in the Apostolic Palace’s reception hall.

6.meeting: Miyazaki joined Toei Animation in the early 1960s and frequently visited Tezuka’s Mushi Production studio in Tokyo to consult on _Kimba the White Lion_.

7.meeting: Both lived and drew together at the Tokiwa-sō apartment in Toshima City from 1952–1958, as shown in the July 2 1958 group photo.

8.meeting: They posed together for a _Gekiman_ promotional still at Kodansha’s offices in Tokyo in the mid-1970s.

9.meeting: They first met at the 1983 _Shōnen Jump_ anniversary event held at Tokyo Big Sight.

10.meeting: They appeared together on the “Manga Masters” panel at Jump Festa ’99 in Makuhari Messe.

11.meeting: Kishimoto sketched Naruto during the original _Naruto_ cover-art session at Weekly _Shōnen Jump’s_ editorial studio in 1999.
